dojg.description: A structure indicating that no matter how hard someone may try, something is impossible.
dojg.meaning: Not ~ by any means; no matter how hard ~ try, ~ cannot ~; there is no way to ~; cannot do ~ at all

examples.japanese: (ksa).私には小説などはどうにも書けない。
examples.english: I’d never be able to write something like a novel, no matter how hard I try.

examples.japanese: (ksb).この作文は間違いがひどくてどうにも直しようがない。
examples.english: This composition has such awful mistakes that there is no way to ﬁx it.

examples.japanese: (ksc).最近は携帯がないとどうにも仕事にならない。
examples.english: Lately we can’t work without a cell phone.

examples.japanese: (a).この書類は印刷が悪くてどうにも読めない。
examples.english: This document is printed so poorly, there’s no way we can read it.

examples.japanese: (b).あの人はあまりにも内気でどうにも好きになれない。
examples.english: He is so introverted, I don’t think I’ll ever grow to like him.

examples.japanese: (c).人の悪口をかげで言うなどということはどうにも許せない。
examples.english: I can’t possibly tolerate someone speaking ill of me behind my back.

examples.japanese: (d).会社経営で破綻寸前まで来るとどうにも救いようがない。
examples.english: When a company’s management is on the verge of bankruptcy, there is no way to salvage it.

examples.japanese: (e).これだけストレスが溜まると、どうにも解消しようがない。
examples.english: When stress piles up this much, there’s no way to relieve it.

examples.japanese: (f).バブル経済崩壊後の日本の経済の低迷ぶりはひどいものだけれど、どうにもならない。
examples.english: The Japanese economic slump since the bubble economy burst is terrible, but there is no help for it.

examples.japanese: (g).色々お礼の言葉を書こうと思っていたのですが、どうにも言葉になりません。今まで本当にありがとうございました。
examples.english: I was going to send you a thank-you note but I just couldn’t ﬁnd the words to say what I meant. Thank you very much!
